docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of women are using heavily advertised vaginal douches even as lingering questions about whether the cleansing products do more harm than good are drawing the attention of Federal regulators. While new data continue to show that vaginal douching, or washing, might increase the risks of pelvic inflammatory disease and tubal pregnancy, Federal health officials say a direct link has not been established.
docs.abstract: Millions of women continue using heavily advertised vaginal douches even as questions about their safety draw attention of Federal regulators; new data continue to show douching might increase risks of pelvic inflammatory disease and tubal pregnancy, but officials of Food and Drug Administration are awaiting results of more study to determine whether changes are needed in availability or labeling of products; manufacturers estimate more than 200 million units are used each year by 40 million American women (M)
